analyzed: yathākatham pana āvuso imassa bhāsitassa attho daṭṭhabbo ti

original: “Sīlavisuddhiñce, āvuso, bhagavā anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya, saupādānaṁyeva samānaṁ anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya.

translated: “If the Blessed One were to describe the unconditioned by way of purification of virtue, he would describe the unconditioned as still accompanied by clinging.

original: Cittavisuddhiñce, āvuso, bhagavā anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya, saupādānaṁyeva samānaṁ anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya.🔽Diṭṭhivisuddhiñce, āvuso, bhagavā anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya, saupādānaṁyeva samānaṁ anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya.🔽Kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhiñce, āvuso, bhagavā anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya, saupādānaṁyeva samānaṁ anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya.

translated: If the Blessed One were to describe the unconditioned by way of purification of mind, he would describe the unconditioned as still accompanied by clinging.🔽If the Blessed One were to describe the unconditioned by way of purification of view, he would describe the unconditioned as still accompanied by clinging.🔽If the Blessed One were to describe the unconditioned by way of purification by overcoming doubt, he would describe the unconditioned as still accompanied by clinging.

original: Maggāmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhiñce, āvuso, bhagavā anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya, saupādānaṁyeva samānaṁ anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya.
analyzed: magga amagga ñāṇa dassana visuddhim ce āvuso bhagavā anupādā parinibbānam paññapeyya sa aupādānayā iva samānam anupādā parinibbānam paññapeyya
translated: If the Blessed One were to describe the unconditioned by way of purification by knowledge & vision of what is & isn’t the path, he would describe the unconditioned as still accompanied by clinging.

original: Paṭipadāñāṇadassanavisuddhiñce, āvuso, bhagavā anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya, saupādānaṁyeva samānaṁ anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya.
analyzed: paṭipadā ñāṇa dassana visuddhim ce āvuso bhagavā anupādā parinibbānam paññapeyya sa aupādānayā iva samānam anupādā parinibbānam paññapeyya
translated: If the Blessed One were to describe the complete fading and cessation of passion, aversion, and delusion as the complete fading and cessation of clinging, he would describe what is subject to clinging as the complete fading and cessation of clinging.

original: Ñāṇadassanavisuddhiñce, āvuso, bhagavā anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya, saupādānaṁyeva samānaṁ anupādāparinibbānaṁ paññapeyya.
analyzed: ñāṇa dassana visuddhim ce āvuso bhagavā anupādā parinibbānam paññapeyya sa aupādānayā iva samānam anupādā parinibbānam paññapeyya
translated: If the Blessed One were to describe the complete fading and cessation of passion, aversion, and delusion as the complete fading and cessation of knowledge and vision, he would describe what is subject to knowledge and vision as the complete fading and cessation of knowledge and vision.

original: Aññatra ce, āvuso, imehi dhammehi anupādāparinibbānaṁ abhavissa, puthujjano parinibbāyeyya.
analyzed: aññatra ce āvuso imehi dhammehi an upādā parinibbānam abhavissa puthujjanaḥ parinibbāyeyya
translated: If the complete fading and cessation of clinging were to be apart from these things, an ordinary person would attain the complete fading and cessation of clinging.

original: Puthujjano hi, āvuso, aññatra imehi dhammehi.
analyzed: puthujjanaḥ hi āvuso aññatra imehi dhammehi
translated: For an ordinary person is apart from these things.

original: Tena hāvuso, upamaṁ te karissāmi;
analyzed: tena ha āvuso upamam te karissāmi
translated: “Come, friend Visākhā, I will give you a simile.

original: upamāyapidhekacce viññū purisā bhāsitassa atthaṁ ājānanti.
analyzed: viññū purisāḥ bhāsitassa attham ājānanti
translated: For through a simile some wise people understand the meaning of what is said.

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, rañño pasenadissa kosalassa sāvatthiyaṁ paṭivasantassa sākete kiñcideva accāyikaṁ karaṇīyaṁ uppajjeyya.
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso raññaḥ pasenadissa kosalassa sāvatthiyam paṭivasantassa sākete kiñcid eva accāyikam karaṇīyam uppajjeyya
translated: Suppose, friend Visākhā, while King Pasenadi of Kosala was living at Sāvatthī, some urgent business connected with his harem arose for him at Sāketa.

original: Tassa antarā ca sāvatthiṁ antarā ca sāketaṁ satta rathavinītāni upaṭṭhapeyyuṁ.
analyzed: tassa antarā ca sāvatthim antarā ca sāketam satta ratha vinītāni upaṭṭhapeyyu
translated: Seven chariots would be harnessed for him,

original: Atha kho, āvuso, rājā pasenadi kosalo sāvatthiyā nikkhamitvā antepuradvārā paṭhamaṁ
analyzed: atha kho āvuso rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ sāvatthiyā nikkhamitvā antepura dvārā
translated: Then, friends, King Pasenadi of Kosala, having left Sāvatthī and the outer gate of the royal compound,

original: rathavinītaṁ abhiruheyya, paṭhamena rathavinītena dutiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇeyya,🔽paṭhamaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjeyya dutiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruheyya.🔽Dutiyena rathavinītena tatiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇeyya, dutiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjeyya, tatiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruheyya.🔽Tatiyena rathavinītena catutthaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇeyya, tatiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjeyya, catutthaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruheyya.
analyzed: ratha vinītam abhiruheyya paṭhamena ratha vinītena dutiyam ratha vinītam pāpuṇeyya  paṭhamam ratha vinītam vissajjeyya dutiyam ratha vinītam abhiruheyya  dutiyena ratha vinītena tatiyam ratha vinītam pāpuṇeyya dutiyam ratha vinītam vissajjeyya tatiyam ratha vinītam abhiruheyya  tatiyena ratha vinītena catuttham ratha vinītam pāpuṇeyya tatiyam ratha vinītam vissajjeyya catuttham ratha vinītam abhiruheyya
translated: Then, friend, King Pasenadi of Kosala, having left Sāvatthī, would mount the first chariot and by the first chariot would reach the second chariot;🔽he would leave the first chariot and mount the second chariot.🔽By the second chariot he would reach the third chariot; he would leave the second chariot and mount the third chariot.🔽By the third chariot he would reach the fourth chariot; he would leave the third chariot and mount the fourth chariot.

original: Catutthena rathavinītena pañcamaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇeyya, catutthaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjeyya, pañcamaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruheyya.
analyzed: catutthena ratha vinītena pañcamam ratha vinītam pāpuṇeyya catuttham ratha vinītam vissajjeyya pañcamam ratha vinītam abhiruheyya
translated: By the fourth chariot he would reach the fifth chariot; he would leave the fourth chariot and mount the fifth chariot.

original: Pañcamena rathavinītena chaṭṭhaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇeyya, pañcamaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjeyya, chaṭṭhaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruheyya.🔽Chaṭṭhena rathavinītena sattamaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇeyya, chaṭṭhaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjeyya, sattamaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruheyya.
analyzed: pañcamena ratha vinītena chaṭṭham ratha vinītam pāpuṇeyya pañcamam ratha vinītam vissajjeyya chaṭṭham ratha vinītam abhiruheyya  chaṭṭhena ratha vinītena sattamam ratha vinītam pāpuṇeyya chaṭṭham ratha vinītam vissajjeyya sattamam ratha vinītam abhiruheyya
translated: He would then go on to the sixth chariot, leaving the fifth behind, and ride on it.🔽He would then go on to the seventh chariot, leaving the sixth behind, and ride on it.

original: Sattamena rathavinītena sāketaṁ anupāpuṇeyya antepuradvāraṁ.
analyzed: sattamena ratha vinītena sāketam anupāpuṇeyya antepura dvāra
translated: He would then go on to Sāketa, to the door of the inner palace.

original: Tamenaṁ antepuradvāragataṁ samānaṁ mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā evaṁ puccheyyuṁ:
analyzed: tam enam antepura dvāra gatam samānam mitta amaccāḥ ñāti sālohitāḥ evam puccheyyuḥ
translated: When he had arrived there, his friends, acquaintances, and blood-relatives would ask him:

original: ‘iminā tvaṁ, mahārāja, rathavinītena sāvatthiyā sāketaṁ anuppatto antepuradvāran’ti?
analyzed: iminā tva mahā rāja ratha vinītena sāvatthiyā sāketam an uppattaḥ antepura dvāra nti
translated: ‘Great king, did you come from Sāvatthī to Sāketa by this chariot?’

original: Kathaṁ byākaramāno nu kho, āvuso, rājā pasenadi kosalo sammā byākaramāno byākareyyā”ti?
analyzed: katham byākaramānaḥ nu khalu āvuso rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ sammā byākaramānaḥ byākareyya ati
translated: How should King Pasenadi answer if he is to answer rightly?”

original: “Evaṁ byākaramāno kho, āvuso, rājā pasenadi kosalo sammā byākaramāno byākareyya:
analyzed: evam byākaramānaḥ kho āvuso rājā pasenadi kosalo sammā byākaramānaḥ byākareyya
translated: “If he is to answer rightly, friend, King Pasenadi should answer thus:

original: ‘idha me sāvatthiyaṁ paṭivasantassa sākete kiñcideva accāyikaṁ karaṇīyaṁ uppajji.
analyzed: idha me sāvatthiyam paṭivasantassa sākete kiñcid eva accāyikam karaṇīyam uppajji
translated: ‘I had some important business in Sāketa.

original: Tassa me antarā ca sāvatthiṁ antarā ca sāketaṁ satta rathavinītāni upaṭṭhapesuṁ.🔽Atha khvāhaṁ sāvatthiyā nikkhamitvā antepuradvārā paṭhamaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruhiṁ.🔽Paṭhamena rathavinītena dutiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇiṁ, paṭhamaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjiṁ dutiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruhiṁ.🔽Dutiyena rathavinītena tatiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇiṁ, dutiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjiṁ, tatiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruhiṁ.
analyzed: tassa me antarā ca sāvatthim antarā ca sāketam satta ratha vinītāni upaṭṭhapesu  atha khvā aham sāvatthiyāḥ nikkhamitvā antepura dvārā paṭhamam ratha vinītam abhiruhi  paṭhamena ratha vinītena dutiyam ratha vinītam pāpuṇi paṭhamam ratha vinītam vissajjim dutiyam ratha vinītam abhiruhi  dutiyena ratha vinītena tatiyam ratha vinītam pāpuṇi dutiyam ratha vinītam vissajji tatiyam ratha vinītam abhiruhi
translated: So I had seven chariots prepared between Sāvatthī and Sāketa.🔽I left Sāvatthī and rode in the first chariot as far as the first chariot station.🔽I left the first chariot and rode in the second chariot as far as the second chariot station.🔽I left the second chariot and rode in the third chariot as far as the third chariot station.

original: Tatiyena rathavinītena catutthaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇiṁ, tatiyaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjiṁ, catutthaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruhiṁ.
analyzed: tatiyena ratha vinītena catuttham ratha vinītam pāpuṇi tatiyam ratha vinītam vissajji catuttham ratha vinītam abhiruhi
translated: I left the third chariot and rode in the fourth chariot as far as the fourth chariot station.

original: Catutthena rathavinītena pañcamaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇiṁ, catutthaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjiṁ, pañcamaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruhiṁ.🔽Pañcamena rathavinītena chaṭṭhaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇiṁ, pañcamaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjiṁ, chaṭṭhaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruhiṁ.
analyzed: catutthena ratha vinītena pañcamam ratha vinītam pāpuṇi catuttham ratha vinītam vissajji pañcamam ratha vinītam abhiruhi  pañcamena ratha vinītena chaṭṭham ratha vinītam pāpuṇi pañcamam ratha vinītam vissajji chaṭṭham ratha vinītam abhiruhi
translated: With the fourth I reached the fifth, and I dismissed the fourth and mounted the fifth.🔽With the fifth I reached the sixth, and I dismissed the fifth and mounted the sixth.

original: Chaṭṭhena rathavinītena sattamaṁ rathavinītaṁ pāpuṇiṁ, chaṭṭhaṁ rathavinītaṁ vissajjiṁ, sattamaṁ rathavinītaṁ abhiruhiṁ.
analyzed: chaṭṭhena ratha vinītena sattamam ratha vinītam pāpuṇi chaṭṭham ratha vinītam vissajji sattamam ratha vinītam abhiruhi
translated: With the sixth I reached the seventh, and I dismissed the sixth and mounted the seventh.

original: Sattamena rathavinītena sāketaṁ anuppatto antepuradvāran’ti.
analyzed: sattamena ratha vinītena sāketam an uppattaḥ antepura dvāra nti
translated: With the seventh I reached Sāketa, the gateway to the royal palace.’

original: Evaṁ byākaramāno kho, āvuso, rājā pasenadi kosalo sammā byākaramāno byākareyyā”ti.🔽“Evameva kho, āvuso, sīlavisuddhi yāvadeva cittavisuddhatthā, cittavisuddhi yāvadeva
analyzed: evam byākaramānaḥ kho āvuso rājā pasenadi kosalo sammā byākaramānaḥ byākareyya ati  evam eva kho āvuso sīla visuddhi yāvat eva citta visuddhatthā citta visuddhi yāvat eva
translated: If King Pasenadi of Kosala were to answer like this, he would answer correctly.”

original: diṭṭhivisuddhatthā, diṭṭhivisuddhi yāvadeva kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhatthā, kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhi
analyzed: diṭṭhi visuddhatthā diṭṭhi visuddhi yāvat eva kaṅkhā vitaraṇa visuddhatthā kaṅkhā vitaraṇa visuddhi
translated: “So too, friend, purification of virtue is for the sake of purification of mind; purification of mind is for the sake of purification of view; purification of view is for the sake of purification by overcoming doubt; purification by overcoming doubt is for the sake of purification by knowledge and vision of what is the path and what is not the path; purification by knowledge and vision of what is the path and what is not the path is for the sake of purification by knowledge and vision of the way; purification by knowledge and vision of the way is for the sake of purification by knowledge and vision; purification by knowledge and vision is for the sake of the fruit of knowledge and vision; the fruit of knowledge and vision is for the sake of realization of the fruit of knowledge and vision; realization of the fruit of knowledge and vision is for the sake of the destruction of the taints.

original: yāvadeva maggāmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhatthā, maggāmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhi yāvadeva
analyzed: yāvat eva maggāmagga ñāṇa dassana visuddhatthā maggāmagga ñāṇa dassana visuddhi yāvat eva
translated: for the purification of knowledge and vision of what is and isn’t the path,🔽for the purification of knowledge and vision of practice,

original: paṭipadāñāṇadassanavisuddhatthā, paṭipadāñāṇadassanavisuddhi yāvadeva ñāṇadassanavisuddhatthā,
analyzed: paṭipadā ñāṇa dassana visuddhatthā paṭipadā ñāṇa dassana visuddhi yāvat eva ñāṇa dassana visuddhatthā
translated: for the purification of knowledge and vision,

original: ñāṇadassanavisuddhi yāvadeva anupādāparinibbānatthā.
translated: for the sake of unbinding through non-grasping.

original: Anupādāparinibbānatthaṁ kho, āvuso, bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ vussatī”ti.
analyzed: an upādā parinibbāna attham kho āvuso bhagavati brahmacariyam vussati iti
translated: It’s for the sake of unbinding through non-grasping that the holy life is lived under the Blessed One.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṁ puṇṇaṁ mantāṇiputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmā sāriputtaḥ āyasmantam puṇṇam mantāṇi puttam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Ven. Sāriputta said to Ven. Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta,

original: “konāmo āyasmā, kathañca panāyasmantaṁ sabrahmacārī jānantī”ti?
analyzed: āyasmā kathañca pana āyasmantam sabrahmacārī jānanti iti
translated: “What is the name of the venerable one’s teacher? In whose Dhamma have you gone forth?”

original: “Puṇṇoti kho me, āvuso, nāmaṁ;
analyzed: puṇṇaḥ iti khalu me āvuso nāma
translated: “My name is Puṇṇa, friend.
